boat.name: Tern
boat.full_description:
In a Regatta Programme, 1897, she is listed as Class I (25 ft LWL), sail no 7, Owner WA King, AG King & TJ King Ardvara, Cultra who also owned Duet.

Converted to yawl, 1920, then back to cutter with reduced sail area. She is one of a class of ten boats built by John Hilditch for a cost of £240.

The Class raced in Belfast Lough and at sea until 1912 when they were all converted to yawl rig for cruising. 'Tern' arrived in Cornish waters about 1947 and was used for day trips changing hands in1949. She was given a new deck and coach roof in 1955. On his cousin's death, George Ellison bought her from his estate and undertook much restoration work at his company Falmouth Boat Construction Flushing.
boat.construction_details:
Carvel 1 inch Pitch pine on 1 3/4 x 1 1/2 inch grown oak at 1 foot spacings, oak and iron floors.
Fastenings - copper nails and bronze screws. Cast iron keel
boat.short_description: Tern is a Belfast Lough Design built in 1897.
